heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: A significant rainy period is on-going and is ranked 11th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 5 consecutive days beginning 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 587 m), feels like temperature (up 3.6°C), outside temperature (up 2.4°C), and inside temperature (up 2.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 104.5m lower than yesterday, 146.2m lower than the past week, 587.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 939m and a high of 3180m, averaging 1681.8m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and sunlight will be very intense and bright. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
